intro: Tarenna kivuensis, commonly known as the Kivu tarenna, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Tarenna kivuensis is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
